name: Worth County Deer Jerky
author: Kristi Whittington
summary: Easily made, this is the best deer jerky recipe I have found. There are a lot of good ingredients that account for the wonderful blend of flavors. My husband and kids love it.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (e.g. Tabasco™), or to taste
1 pound venison, cut into 1 x 1/4 inch strips
directions: Stir together Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, liquid smoke, lemon juice, teriyaki sauce, ketchup, and hot pepper sauce in a bowl
Season with garlic powder, onion powder, and pepper
Mix in the sliced venison until completely coated
Cover tightly, and marinate at least 8 hours in the refrigerator

Prepare jerky in a food dehydrator according to manufacturer's directions, or dry on racks in the oven at 150 degrees F (65 degrees C) until the jerky has dried and will snap when bent, 10 to 12 hours
